EXTRACTED VALUE: DeShawn Stevenson exercised his player option for the 2010/11 season.
Nets guard Keyon Dooling was inactive on Monday because of a groin injury.
Eddie House hit 6-of-9 shots and three 3-pointers for 15 points in Wednesday's easy win.
Jamaal Magloire had season-highs of 10 rebounds and two blocks in 21 minutes in Monday's win over the Hawks.
Back up center Sean Marks left Friday's game with a sprained ankle after scoring six points.
Hedo Turkoglu had 15 points, eight rebounds, two blocks and three 3-pointers on 6-of-13 shooting Monday.
Mike Miller (thumb) is hoping to return by Christmas, but Heat coach Erik Spoelstra isn't so sure.
Morris Peterson, Julian Wright, and James Posey combined to shoot 3-of-20 in a blowout loss on Saturday.
Quentin Richardson will return to Orlando's starting lineup vs. the Raptors on Friday -- and he will remain a starter for the foreseeable future.
Raja Bell (thigh) is still considered a game-time decision for Wednesday's game against the Nets.
Kenyon Martin (knee) hinted that he could be back earlier than George Karl's Jan. 1 projected date.
Michael Redd, who will have earned more than $100 million from the Bucks, is not likely to play again in Milwaukee.
Joel Przybilla (knee, flu) will join the Trail Blazers in Boston for Wednesday's game, though he is not expected to play.
Eduardo Najera is three weeks away from being able to practice after undergoing sports hernia surgery on Sept. 10.
